text: Here’s what’s happening now with mortgage rates after Trump's latest push on housing affordability - CNBC
fullText: President Donald Trump posted on social media Thursday that he is instructing mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy $200 billion in mortgage bonds.

text: Winter storm slams UK and France as cold snap spreads across Europe - AP News
fullText: Thousands of homes and businesses across northern France and southern England are without power and residents faced widespread travel delays after a storm swept in off the Atlantic. The low-pressure system named Storm Goretti brought high winds, rain and snow…

text: Minneapolis shooting live updates: Agent who killed Renee Nicole Good identified; protests grow after 2 shot by Border Patrol in Portland - Yahoo
fullText: The fatal shooting of a woman by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer in Minneapolis continues to spark outrage across the country as video...

text: Pope Leo says ‘war is back in vogue’ in major address to global envoys - CNN
fullText: Pope Leo XIV has said the prohibition on countries violating one another’s borders has been “completely undermined,” in an important speech to diplomats gathered in the Vatican.

text: Massive iconic iceberg turns blue and is "on the verge of complete disintegration," NASA says - CBS News
fullText: Scientists say all signs indicate the so-called "megaberg" could be just days or weeks from totally disintegrating.

text: U.S. payrolls rose 50,000 in December, less than expected; unemployment rate falls to 4.4% - CNBC
fullText: The report presented a muddy view of the labor market, with companies reporting a low level of hiring but households showing employment gains.

text: Venezuela releases imprisoned opposition figures, which Trump says U.S. requested - NPR
fullText: Venezuela released a number of imprisoned high-profile opposition figures, activists and journalists, in what the government described as a gesture to "seek peace".

text: US builds case to retain measles elimination status as infections mount - CNN
fullText: U.S. officials are building a case that ongoing measles outbreaks in South Carolina and other states are unrelated to last year’s major outbreak in Texas, as it tries to retain its status of having eliminated the disease after recording the highest number of …

text: BAFTA Awards Longlists: One Battle After Another Leads Hamnet, Sinners - Variety
fullText: The BAFTA Awards longlists were led by "One Battle After Another" with 16 nods, followed by "Hamnet" and "Sinners" with 14 each.

text: Catherine's birthday message on healing power of nature - BBC
fullText: The message is part of a video series which has seen Catherine reflect on the importance of nature to her, during her recovery from cancer treatment.

text: Submarine Vanishes Beneath Antarctic Ice After Uncovering Mysterious Hidden Structures Scientists Can't Explain - The Daily Galaxy
fullText: A groundbreaking Antarctic mission revealed bizarre hidden structures beneath a melting ice shelf, then the research robot vanished without a trace.

text: Scientists find new clues to why female fertility declines with age - The Washington Post
fullText: New studies are shedding light on one of the biggest mysteries of human reproduction and what can be done to combat it.

text: Hero or brutal tyrant? The controversy over 16th-Century explorer Magellan - BBC
fullText: An acclaimed new film dramatises the pioneering voyage of the world-famous Portuguese navigator – a trailblazer who has been accused of "incontinent bloodlust".

text: Your next primary care doctor could be online only, accessed through an AI tool : Shots - Health News - NPR
fullText: The shortage of primary care doctors is a national problem. To cope, a large health system in Massachusetts is using an AI tool to screen patients and refer them to other care.

text: Elon Musk's Grok AI image editing limited to paid users after deepfakes - BBC
fullText: It comes after government urged Ofcom to use all its powers – up to and including an effective ban – against X.

text: Donald Trump, 79, Tries to Blame Egomaniacal Phrase on Someone Else - The Daily Beast
fullText: The president attempted to distance himself from a Trumpy term he has definitely used.

text: A galaxy cluster hotter than the surface of the sun is shocking researchers : Short Wave - NPR
fullText: Most astronomers agree that young galaxy clusters should be relatively cool compared to older ones. But researchers recently found a very young cluster that’s hotter than the surface of the sun. More on why the finding is so shocking, plus elephant’s remarkab…
